anomalies: s1187: $6.12 (B session — batch-service-probe + directive fix, high but justified)
s1189: $0.00 (B session — agent-reported source recorded $0. 15-cost-pipeline only fixed A sessions, B sessions with agent-reported=0 not caught)

recommended_actions.description: Cost pipeline records $0.00 for s1189 (B session) because agent-reported source is used. The wq-403 fix only skips agent-reported for A sessions. B sessions writing session-cost.txt with $0 or near-$0 should also fall through to token-calc. s1152 also affected ($0.08).
recommended_actions.action: Extend 15-cost-pipeline.sh to skip agent-reported source when reported value is $0 or below a minimum threshold (e.g., $0.10), regardless of session type. This catches edge cases across all session types without removing agent-reported for B sessions entirely.

recommended_actions.description: Hook 36-circuit-reset.sh has failed 4 times with timeout (exit=124). R#205 added timeout penalty (30s→15s) but hook still fails at 15s. This wastes 15s of pre-session budget every startup and the hook provides no value when downstream services are unreachable.
recommended_actions.action: Add a circuit-breaker for the circuit-breaker hook itself: if 36-circuit-reset.sh has failed 3+ consecutive sessions, skip probing and just log. Or reduce its timeout to 5s — if a service doesn't respond in 5s it's definitely still open.
